fullText: The musical version of Groundhog Day, which opened Thursday night at the August Wilson Theatre, is a surprisingly successful adaptation that manages to find new emotional depths in the familiar story.
dtliExcerpt: The musical version of Groundhog Day, which opened Thursday night at the August Wilson Theatre, is a surprisingly successful adaptation that manages to find new emotional depths in the familiar story.
bwwExcerpt: Which is not to say that the manic business of the first act is entirely excused by the richer reflectiveness of the second. There were plenty of times throughout when I felt, with Phil, that I'd seen this all before. The adaptation from the film is, in that sense, too faithful; despite the musical's theatrical cleverness it is often literal and choppy, like word-by-word Google translation. But at least it gets better as it loops along. Perhaps all it needs is a few thousand more iterations.
